title: Hoover PD: Child struck by bullet while sitting in apartment
content:
HOOVER, AL (WBRC) -
Hoover police are investigating after a 10-year-old child was struck by a bullet while sitting in the living room of his family's apartment Tuesday night.
Police responded to the Warringwood Heights Apartments on Warringwood Drive around 10:32 p.m.
Officers learned that a bullet passed through the wall separating the two apartments and struck the child in the groin.
The 10-year-old was transported to Children's of Alabama hospital. He was alert and conscious at the time but police do not have an update on his condition.
The person in the other apartment at the time of the shooting initially fled the scene, but Lt. Keith Czeskleba said that person has turned himself in to police and is in custody for questioning.
The suspect remains in the Hoover City Jail pending formal charges later Wednesday.
